Both movies are set in the 1940s and explore themes of family, identity, and cultural heritage. "Wish You Well" follows a young girl and her brother as they come of age at their great-grandmother's house in Virginia, while "The Clan of the Cave Bear" tells the story of a young Cro-Magnon woman who is raised by Neanderthals. Both movies have strong performances from the actors and offer a fascinating glimpse into historical contexts that are different from our own.
